title: Image created by mlflow run with docker_env does not have the same structure as the project
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: Yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Centos 7
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 1.0.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.8
- **npm version (if running the dev UI)**: N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**: 
Create an MLproject with the below structure and contents:
```
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ tree
.
├── Dockerfile
├── mlflow_test
│   ├── __init__.py
│   └── run.py
└── MLproject
```

Dockerfile:
```
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ cat Dockerfile
FROM python:3.6
```

MLProject:
```
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ cat MLproject
name: mlflow_test

docker_env:
    image: test_image

entry_points:
    main:
        command: python mlflow_test/run.py
```

mlflow_test/run.py
```
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ cat mlflow_test/run.py
print("hello world")
```

mlflow_test/\_\_init\_\_.py is empty

Run:
```
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ docker build -t test_image .
Sending build context to Docker daemon  16.38kB
Step 1/1 : FROM python:3.6
3.6: Pulling from library/python
Digest: sha256:d0f068df622b07c06e7753a95fc826747c0e9668992c41f09d5c37ad48d4fb17
Status: Downloaded newer image for python:3.6
 ---> 0668df180a32
Successfully built 0668df180a32
Successfully tagged test_image:latest
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ mlflow run .
2019/06/06 16:20:15 INFO mlflow.projects: === Building docker image mlflow-mlflow_test ===
2019/06/06 16:20:16 INFO mlflow.projects: === Created directory /tmp/tmpirkehm00 for downloading remote URIs passed to arguments of type 'path' ===
2019/06/06 16:20:16 INFO mlflow.projects: === Running command 'docker run --rm -v /tmp/mlflow_test/mlruns:/mlflow/tmp/mlruns -e MLFLOW_RUN_ID=6a7d4250966941b8a7a15b3a378e99a6 -e MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=file:///mlflow/tmp/mlruns -e MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_ID=0 mlflow-mlflow_test python mlflow_test/run.py' in run with ID '6a7d4250966941b8a7a15b3a378e99a6' ===
python: can't open file 'mlflow_test/run.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory
2019/06/06 16:20:17 ERROR mlflow.cli: === Run (ID '6a7d4250966941b8a7a15b3a378e99a6') failed ===
```

### Describe the problem
The directory structure inside the MLFlow image is flattened by one level:
```
(mlflow) [ahutter@ahutter-dev mlflow_test]$ docker run -it --entrypoint ls mlflow-mlflow_test
0  Dockerfile  Dockerfile.mlflow-autogenerated	MLproject  __init__.py	run.py
```
